Benjamin Robert Moody II (Little Rock, Arkansas; January 22, 1980), better known as Ben Moody, is a singer, songwriter, multi-instrumentalist, and producer. American musical.

Co-founder, guitarist and composer of the band Evanescence, a band to which he belonged from 1995 to October 2003; Since leaving Evanescence, Moody has collaborated with several US artists and performers, released two solo albums, and is currently a member and founder of the gothic rock group We Are The Fallen and the alternative rock group The Halo Method.

On January 12, 2013, he married actress Jaclyn Napier. The couple has two children.

Musical career

Principles in Evanescence

Moody and Amy Lee met in 1994, when they were at a youth camp. Ben heard her play "I'd Do Anything for Love (But I Won't Do That)" by Meat Loaf on the piano and he liked it; The two became friends, and together they formed Evanescence. They soon began playing music in local stores and in 1996 the duo began selling EPs at local fairs, culminating in their discovery by Wind-up Records and the release of their successful debut album, Fallen. i>. On the European tour of the album Fallen, in October 2003; Moody abruptly left the band citing creative differences with Amy Lee.

Collaborations

Starting in 2004, Moody began collaborating with a variety of artists, working in multiple disciplines. That same year, she co-wrote the song 'Nobody's Home'. for Avril Lavigne's second album, Under My Skin; and she wrote and recorded the song 'The End Has Come', featuring Jason C. Miller and Jason 'Gong'. Jones for The Punisher soundtrack; He then collaborated with David Hodges, Kelly Clarkson, and other songwriters on her second album, titled Breakaway, working on the songs "Because of You" and "Addicted". In early 2005, Moody played lead guitar on the song 'Forever in Our Hearts', the song for tsunami victims made exclusively for iTunes, he also collaborated with singer Anastacia on the song Everything Burns song that was used on the Fantastic Four soundtrack. In 2007, Moody worked with Céline Dion on her album Taking Chances, and has collaborated with other artists such as Hana Pestle among others.

Solo career

On December 16, 2008, Moody released his first songs as a solo artist on the Mutiny Bootleg EP, Ben Moody stated that in the EP there was a collaboration between Hana Pestle i> that would not be published on the album; The EP was free. On June 9, 2009, Moody released his first solo album titled All For This digitally, via Amazon.com, iTunes and Amie Street. On November 11, 2011 he released his second solo album, titled You Can't Regret What You Don't Remember digitally, via Amazon.com and iTunes.

We Are The Fallen

In June 2009, Ben Moody unveiled his new project, known as We Are The Fallen, which is made up of him and his former colleagues from Evanescence, guitarist John Lecompt and drummer Rocky Gray accompanied by his best friend Ben, the bassist Marty O'Brien (ex Static-X) and on vocals, the Irish Carly Smithson.

We Are The Fallen made their first public appearance on June 22, 2009, where the band played their first single "Bury Me Alive"; Some time later they released their debut album which is titled, Tear the World Down, and in 2012 they released their first DVD called Cirque Des Damnes. This DVD shows the most recent performance of We Are The Fallen in their hometown, Los Angeles. This was a special show, as it was done to celebrate Moody's 30th birthday; In this DVD you can see a duet between Ben and his girlfriend (Hana Pestle)

The Halo Method

In 2012, together with vocalist Lukas Rossi and former Papa Roach drummer Dave Buckner, he formed the project The Halo Method; completing the line-up with Josh Newell on bass. They recorded their first album Reset, which came out in May 2013. In 2014, Dave Bucker left the band; In his replacement the drums are in charge of Miles McPherson.

Acting career

Aside from his musical endeavors, Moody works with his television and film production company, Makeshift Films and has also made small appearances in film, such as the zombie character in the film Resident Evil Apocalypse and in the 2007 version of the Lionsgate film, Dead and Gone.
